questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A secure server that provides services to EPG-2 must be placed in EPG-1. The remaining EPGs `" EPG-2, EPG-3, and EPG-4 `" must communicate without any contracts. Which set of actions accomplishes this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is ok

choices.C: Include EPG-2, EPG-3, and EPG-4 in the preferred group. Configure a contract between EPG-1 and EPG-2.
choices.D: Include EPG-1 and EPG-2 in the preferred group. Configure a contract between EPG-2 and EPG-3.
choices.B: Exclude EPG-2, EPG-3, and EPG-4 from the preferred group. Configure a contract between EPG-2 and EPG-3.
choices.A: Exclude EPG-2, EPG-3, and EPG-4 from the preferred group. Configure a contract between EPG-1 and EPG-3.

questions.question_text: The Cisco UCS blade chassis must send SNMPv3 traps to a network monitoring system. The SNMP trap messages should be authenticated and have protection from disclosure. Which SNMP security privilege level should be configured?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct!

Selected Answer: A
If you select V3 for the version, the privilege associated with the trap.
This can be one of the following:
• Auth—Authentication but no encryption
• Noauth—No authentication or encryption
• Priv—Authentication and encryption

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/System-Monitoring/4-0/b_UCSM_GUI_System_Monitoring_Guide_4-0/b_UCSM_GUI_System_Monitoring_Guide_4-0_chapter_0111.pdf

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must implement VXLAN with anycast gateway. To accomplish this, an engineer must set up PIM Source-Specific Multicast for host reachability. Which IP address must be applied to interface loopback1 to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
as per te doc 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/ip-multicast/115011-anycast-pim.html

moreover you need to have 2 loopbacks for pim-anycast RP, one of them has anycast RP configured, another one has unique IP for communicating with other RP switch, so basically any of the A,B,C options could be correct
absolutely terrible question, PIM SSM doesn't require RP

Selected Answer: B
B is ok

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure a Cisco UCS blade system that is managed by Cisco UCS Manager. All four connected interfaces between the blade system and the fabric interconnects must be used. Additionally, the connectivity must tolerate any link failure between the I/O module and the fabric interconnects. Which action accomplishes these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C as per te doc 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Infrastructure-Mgmt/4-0/b_UCSM_CLI_Infrastructure_Management_Guide_4_0/b_UCSM_CLI_Infrastructure_Management_Guide_4_0_chapter_010.html#concept_962E6894D61D49379618278B0741DF11
Option C is right answer here , Option A means do the discovery only if four link from blade to IO

Selected Answer: C
My bet is on C

Selected Answer: C
If
the Link Grouping Preference is set to Port Channel, all of the links from the IOM to the fabric interconnect
are grouped in a fabric port channel

hardware configurations that support fabric port channels, link grouping determines whether all of the links
from the IOM to the fabric interconnect are grouped into a fabric port channel during chassis discovery. If
the Link Grouping Preference is set to Port Channel, all of the links from the IOM to the fabric interconnect
are grouped in a fabric port channel. If this parameter is set to None, links from the IOM to the fabric
interconnect are not grouped in a fabric port channel.

comments.content:
Also, the same document states:
"If you configure Link Grouping Preference as None during chassis discovery, the IOM forwards traffic from a specific server to the fabric interconnect through its uplink ports by using static route pinning."

So I agree that that answer should be [C], where in which we set the Link Group Preference to Port Channel.

Ideally, the question should ask us to choose two answers. Because, configuring the Link Group is part of the Chassis/FEX discovery Policy configuration. 
So [A] and [C]. 
But if they are asking for only one answer, then [C] makes more sense.

I think answer is C
Chassis link action in Chassis/FEX discovery policy sets the minimum number of links to discover the chassis. You must set Link Group Preference to Port Channel if you want fault tolerance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct!

choices.A: Configure chassis/FEX discovery policy action to four links.
choices.D: Configure Firmware Auto Sync Server policy to Auto Acknowledge.
choices.C: Configure Link Group Preference to Port Channel.
choices.B: Configure port aggregation with LACP policy set to default.

choices.C: The package is removed from the switch.
choices.B: The package features for the line card are disabled.
choices.A: The current set of packages is committed.

questions.question_text: What occurs when running the command install deactivate <filename> while a software maintenance upgrade is performed on a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series switch?

discussion.content:
Correct
install deactivate <filename> - Deactivates a package that was added to the device and turns off the package features for the line card.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
